name: blunderingly
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that involves a lot of serious mistakes, usually because of not taking care: The difficult situation was not helped by some of the most blunderingly stupid senior management decisions in the history of the industry. The changes were blunderingly rushed through by the government. Related word
blundering
More examplesFewer examplesThe film is not helped by his blunderingly terrible, overacted performance. They create chaos as they blunderingly attempt to follow her instructions.I was surprised that she had been capable of writing something so blunderingly ugly.The project has taken so long because the leadership behind it has been blunderingly inept.
